About Me

Quick Bio

Though my family is from the Dominican Republic, I was born and raised in NYC. I graduated from Carnegie Mellon University in 2011 and a month later started working for BNY Mellon through their Technology Leadership Development Program. When this ended in March 2013, I remained within Wealth Management Technology as a business analyst and workflow prototyper.

After three years with BNY Mellon, I decided to leave Corporate to dedicate myself full-time to my education technology startup, Leksi. With a product-release right around the corner and traction building, I'm determined to make this a success and have its impact realized, particularly for K-12 students around the country and world.

Hobbies include playing and competing in chess tournaments around the country; staying active through the gym, racquetball, and spin; volunteering at non-profits; and just living and learning, enjoying life. I'm also a member of Kappa Alpha Psi Fraternity, Inc.

ESTJ

According to the Myers-Briggs Type Indicator, my personality falls in the Extraversion, Sensing, Thinking, and Judgement category. Though much can be said here, below are some descriptive statements that fit me best:
  • Have clear visions of the way that things should be, so naturally step into leadership roles
  • Organize projects and people to get things done; focus on getting results in the most efficient way possible
  • Enjoy interacting with people and like to have fun, especially activities which are focused on the family, community, or work
  • Am conscientious, practical, realistic, and dependable

Carpe Diem

These are two Latin words that deliver a simple yet powerful message. Every day we have an opportunity to not try, but do. As we continue to 'do', we take positive steps towards achieving our ambitious goals. For me, I'm relentlessly driven to make the most of my days and future because as Ralph Waldo Emerson once said, 'progress is the activity of today and the assurance of tomorrow'.
